body.p: A. J. Konkle says that he knows Henry. C. Lloyd well & he served faithfully under him as a Lieutenant in the 1st ohio light artillery & untill he was promoted as Captain of the 1st Tennessee light artillery. He is a young man of fine character & deserves well of his country & is not a gambler. He has suffered for his country & passed through an attack of smallpox & from infirm health had to resign. If guilty at all of violating the laws against gaming, it is a mere technical guilt & not a real & intended guilt as a gambler. I hope his indiscretion may be pardoned. He is poor & away from home.
